feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: CAP (Node.js) OData V2 Batch Request using SAP Cloud SDK – How to capture all errors in a changeset?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a use case where I need to send a batch of update/create/delete requests from a SAP CAP (Node.js) backend to an SAP S/4HANA system. I'm using the SAP Cloud SDK and the Business Accelerator Hub to build and send the OData V2 (using odata-v2-adapter) batch requests.

Here’s what I’ve achieved so far:

  • I’m able to send multiple requests (update/create/delete) within a single batch.
  • To ensure transactional behavior, I wrap all these requests into one changeset.
  • This works well from a transactional standpoint: if any request fails, nothing is committed in S/4.

However, here’s the problem, when one request inside the changeset fails, only a single error is returned, and the rest of the requests are not processed. This behavior is expected according to OData V2 specs and SAP Cloud SDK documentation:

  • “The body of a ChangeSet response is either a response for all the successfully processed change request within the ChangeSet [...] or a single response indicating a failure of the entire ChangeSet.” (OData V2)
  • “If the execution of any request within a changeset fails, the whole changeset will be reflected as an error in the response.” (SAP Cloud SDK)

What I tried:

  • Splitting requests into multiple changesets (one per request) within the same batch allows me to retrieve individual errors, but I lose transactional integrity, some changes are committed while others fail.
  • I also explored the continueOnError option from the odata-v2-adapter, but it only applies between multiple changesets, not within a single changeset. So, again, it doesn’t help with my use case. (SAP Community Q&A)

What I’m looking for:

  • Is there any way (official or workaround) to get detailed errors for all requests without sacrificing atomicity?
  • Alternatively, is there a way to simulate or validate a batch in a “check” or “test” mode, without actually executing it in the S/4HANA backend, just to detect all potential errors?
  • Or is the recommended approach, as suggested by CAP documentation, to implement strong input validation before triggering the batch, to ensure that it will succeed?

Any insights, ideas, or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Migration of an HTML application from neo to cloud foundry environment
entry.content:
Hi All, 
I have a problem to solve. Recently, I migrated an HTML5 application from BTP neo to cloud foundry with the process guided on sap help portal. the application got migrated successfully and also, I migrated my destination from my BTP neo to cloud foundry environment in order to connect my application to backend. But when I preview my application, it shows the error in my ui5.yaml file.

Attached pictures are the screenshots of my ui5.yaml file.

Here's the detailed log of the error in my terminal when I'm using command "npm run start":

backend: [{"path":"/sap","url":"http://pvlhe4decc1.lthe.com:8101","client":"110","destination":"S4HANA_DEV"},{"path":"/api/UploadDocumentToSP","destination":"SharePoint","url":""},{"path":"/api/DownloadDocumentFromSP","destination":"SharePoint","url":""}]
info fiori-tools-proxy ui5: [{"path":"/resources","url":"https://ui5.sap.com","version":"1.108.45"},{"path":"/test-resources","url":"https://ui5.sap.com","version":"1.108.45"}]
info fiori-tools-proxy debug: 'false'
info backend-proxy-middleware Using destination: S4HANA_DEV
info backend-proxy-middleware Backend proxy created for https://S4HANA_DEV.dest /sap
error fiori-tools-proxy Failed to register backend for /api/UploadDocumentToSP. Check configuration in yaml file.
error fiori-tools-proxy Error
error fiori-tools-proxy Failed to register backend for /api/UploadDocumentToSP. Check configuration in yaml file.
error fiori-tools-proxy Error

⚠️ Process Failed With Error

Error Message:
Failed to register backend for /api/UploadDocumentToSP. Check configuration in yaml file.
Error

Can someone help me with this error?





Regards,

Abhishek

entry.title: Troubleshoot CAP plugin for Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm currently trying out the CAP plugin for advanced event mesh.

I followed this documentation and tried to tune the bookshop sample to connect to AEM by adding this section in the package.json:

   "requires": {
      "messaging": {
        "kind": "advanced-event-mesh",
        "skipManagement": false,
        "credentials": {
          "user-provided": {
            "name": "advanced-event-mesh"
          }
        },
        "queue": {
          "queueName": "testQ",
          "permission": "EXLUSIVE",
          "ingressEnabled": true,
          "egressEnabled": true
        }
      }
    }

I was first encountering this error message:

/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.


❗️ ERROR on server start: ❗️

 Error: Missing or malformed credentials for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.

Bind your app to a user-provided service with name "advanced-event-mesh" and credentials in the following format:
{
  "authentication-service": {
    "tokenendpoint": "https://<ias host>/oauth2/token",
    "clientid": "<client id>",
    "clientsecret": "<client secret>"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "advanced-event-mesh": {
      "uri": "https://<broker host>:<port>",
      "smf_uri": "wss://<broker host>:<port>"
    }
  },
  "vpn": "<vpn>"
}
    at _validateAndFetchEndpoints (/Users/me/git/cloud-cap-samples/node_modules/@cap-js/advanced-event-mesh/cds-plugin.js:37:91)

So I wired my AEM credentials via user-provided service.
Then followed this error message:

/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.

Error: Missing credentials for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh with plan "aem-validation-service".

You need to create a service binding.
    at _validateBroker (/Users/me/git/cloud-cap-samples/node_modules/@cap-js/advanced-event-mesh/cds-plugin.js:99:11)

So next I created an instance of the aem-validation-service  (in the same subaccount, as learned from this question) and bound it to CAP using cds bind. 

Finally, the cds watch (or cds serve command) starts up with no more errors. But now, somehow it is stuck after this step:

resolving cloud service bindings...
bound messaging to cf user provided service advanced-event-mesh
bound custom-service:cap2aem to cf managed service cap2aem:cap2aem-key
[cds] - loaded model from 7 file(s):

  ../node_modules/@sap/cds/srv/outbox.cds
  srv/user-service.cds
  srv/cat-service.cds
  srv/access-control.cds
  srv/admin-service.cds
  db/schema.cds
  ../node_modules/@sap/cds/common.cds

[cds] - connect to db > sqlite { url: ':memory:' }
  > init from db/init.js 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Genres.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Books.texts.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Books.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Authors.csv 
/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.

The app is not served at localhost:4004, nothing is happening after the log output "successfully deployed to in-memory database".
As I'm not super experienced with CAP, I don't know if I missed something crucial or how the issue could be examined further.

I'm very thankful for every hint or help provided.

entry.title: SAP CAP action with Unstructured/Dynamic Type Input
entry.content:
Following the blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-cap-function-and-action-with-unstructured-dynamic-type-input-output/ba-p/13571201 by @Ajit_K_Panda I was able to create a CAP service with dynamic Output structure, but not a dynamic Input structure.

The service defined in the blog, still requires the input structure, to have the data object name as input, as mentioned in the sample payload:

action   MyAction(input : object)       returns object;
{
    "input":{
        "field1":123,
        "field2":"Value"
    }
}

As soon as I add a new name in the json object, the input validation fails saying: Property "...." does not exist in....

 

{
    "input":{
        "field1":123,
        "field2":"Value"
    },
    "newfield":"newvalue"
}

Is there any option to:

  1. Ignore the names that cannot be mapped, to avoid Property mapping error, OR
  2. Define a completely dynamic input object, similar to how the output is defined (e.g action MyAction(object) returns object;)

entry.title: Deployed CAP+Fiori App is running, but UI gives 404 on metadata call and is not visible in Work Zone
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm developing a full-stack application in SAP Business Application Studio and I'm facing a final issue after a seemingly successful deployment to Cloud Foundry.

My Project Setup:

  • Backend: SAP CAP with Node.js

  • Database: SAP HANA Cloud, using synonyms to access tables from another container.

  • Frontend: SAP Fiori Elements (List Report Object Page template).

  • Security: Using a standard XSUAA service.

  • Deployment Target: The final goal is to integrate the app into our SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

The Problem / Observed Behavior: The deployment to Cloud Foundry using cf deploy completes 100% successfully. In the CF space, I can see that my applications (-srv, -ui) are in the "Started" state, and the -db-deployer is "Stopped", which is the expected behavior.

The issue is that the application is unreachable and invisible to end-users:

  1. When I access the direct URL of the CAP backend service (...-srv.cfapps...), I correctly see the CAP welcome page listing my service endpoint at /odata/v4/catalog. This confirms the backend is alive and serving the correct path.

  2. However, when I access the main UI application URL (...-ui.cfapps...), the page title loads, but the rest of the page is blank.

  3. Checking the browser's developer console, I see a 404 (Not Found) error when the application tries to fetch the service metadata. The failing request is: GET .../odata/v4/catalog/$metadata.

  4. Consequently, the application does not appear in the Content Explorer of the SAP Build Work Zone after refreshing the "HTML5 Apps" content provider.

My Question: What could be the reason for the 404 Not Found error during the metadata call from the UI, given that the deployment is successful and the backend service is confirmed to be running and serving the correct path? It seems there is a routing or communication issue between the AppRouter (-ui app) and the CAP service (-srv app) that I am unable to diagnose further.

Relevant Configuration Files attached

org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'queryExecutorImpl' defined in URL: Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor parameter 1: No qualifying bean of type 'com.sap.cds.services.draft.DraftService' available: more than one 'primary' bean found among candidates: [srv.invoice.archive.InvoiceArchiveConfigService, srv.invoice.form.CreateInvoiceUIService]

How to fix the conflict DraftService bean?

entry.title: Single tenant User-info has been set to null by ProviderTenantNormalizer
entry.content:
Context

  • We forward the end-user token from App A → App B using a Destination with Authentication type: OAuth2UserTokenExchange.

  • com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.openapi.core.AbstractOpenApiService need a tenant id for creating apiClient.

Problem (single-tenant)

After deploying to a single-tenant account, the tenant ID appears to be cleared before our handlers run. I traced this to com.sap.cds.services.impl.mt.ProviderTenantNormalizer:

private static class ProviderTenantNormalizer implements UserInfoProvider {

  private final String providerTenant;
  private UserInfoProvider previous;

  public ProviderTenantNormalizer(String providerTenant) {
    this.providerTenant = providerTenant;
  }

  @Override
  public UserInfo get() {
    UserInfo userInfo = previous != null ? previous.get() : null;
    if (userInfo != null && Objects.equals(userInfo.getTenant(), providerTenant)) {
      userInfo = userInfo.copy().setTenant(null);
    }
    return userInfo;
  }

  @Override
  public void setPrevious(UserInfoProvider previous) {
    this.previous = previous;
  }
}

As shown, when the user’s tenant equals the provider tenant, the tenant is set to null. In a single-tenant scenario, that’s exactly our case, so the tenant is cleared before any handler is called, and the ApiClient from com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.openapi.core can not be instantiated because it needs a tenant ID.

Question

What is the correct way to configure or consume a user-token forwarding/exchange destination (OAuth2UserTokenExchange) in a single-tenant environment where ProviderTenantNormalizer nulls the tenant?

entry.title: SAP CAP project - database layer migration
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an existing SAP CAP project that contains a complete application structure including database models defined in schema.cds files. I want to refactor this monolithic structure by extracting and migrating the entire database layer (including all CDS data models, schema definitions, and database-related artifacts) into a completely separate, standalone CAP project. I will archive the existing project. 

The new database project should maintain the same namespace as the original project to ensure compatibility, and I need to establish proper dependencies and references so that my original project can continue to consume the database models from this new external database project.

How should I structure this migration, handle the cross-project dependencies, configure the build processes, manage deployment scenarios, and ensure that the new CAP project can work seamlessly while maintaining the existing namespace conventions and data model integrity?

Regards,

Minh

entry.title: Which accessor interface to use for db operations in CAP Java project?
entry.content:
CDS compiler generates two sets of accessor interfaces- one for schema layer and another for service layer. Which one should be used for accessing and manipulating data? I didn't find any documentation on this topic so asking here.

The reason behind asking this is that both of the implementations have same names and while using it's possible to mixup them. Can they be used interchangeably?

entry.title: How to navigate from fragment to different ObjectPage?
entry.content:
I created a SAP Fiori Elements UI for a CAP service. I want to have a custom section, so I created one. I want to click on a button within the custom section (being a fragment) and it should navigate me to a working target within my app which is defined in my manifest.json.

I really just want to know how normally one should navigate from fragments to an ObjectPage? I don't know how I can get the Router and use the classic navTo functionality. Or if there is another way of doing it.

entry.title: Unable to Select Structured Type Property in CDS Entity
entry.content:
Hello 

I defined a new type in the CDS service as follows:

type MyNewType {
    prop1 : String;
    prop2 : String;
    prop3 : String;
}

I then used this type in a property within an entity like this:

entity MyEntity {
    period     : String;
    resolution : String;
    properties : MyNewType;
}

However, when I try to select this property using $select=properties, the framework returns an error.

{
    "error": {
        "code": "400",
        "message": "The property 'properties', used in a query expression, is not defined in type 'MyEntity'."
    }
}

I don't see any issue with my declaration. Could you please help me identify and resolve the problem?

Thanks !

entry.title: How to Handle Cross-Global Account Subscriptions and Customer-Managed HANA in CAP SaaS?
entry.content:
A SaaS solution built using SAP CAP (Node.js) with MTX-enabled multitenancy is currently running in production with several subscribed tenants (subaccounts under the same global account).

The solution is deployed as an MTA in a provider subaccount, while each customer has a dedicated subscriber subaccount to consume the application.

HANA setup

At the moment, I use a shared HANA Cloud database. The MTX sidecar creates a Service Manager HDI container for each tenant, and together with the CDS framework, it handles multitenancy properly.

Customer concern

One customer raised data privacy concerns, since the solution connects to their S/4HANA system (via Cloud Connector) and stores data in our HANA Cloud.

My questions

Part 1: Is it possible for a customer to subscribe to the SaaS application from a subaccount in a different global account (not the same global account as the provider subaccount)? I am particularly thinking about potential XSUAA-related challenges here.

Part 2: Is it possible to support a “bring your own HANA” (BYO HANA) model, where the CDS framework would connect to a customer-managed HANA instance instead of the shared one?

I understand this may be a stretch given the current state of CAP applications, but I’d appreciate any insights into what SAP offers in terms of architectural possibilities and limitations in this area.

Thank you !

entry.title: How to consume OData service in Fiori app using approuter and destination in Cloud Foundry (404 Not
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am developing a CAP project on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry. I want to consume an OData V4 service from a Fiori (UI5) application using approuter and a destination.

- Backend (CAP, OData V4):
https://<subdomain>-back.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/v4/invitacion/ReadProveedor

- Frontend (Fiori + approuter):
https://<subdomain>-frontend.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/frontfront/index.html

### Approuter (xs-app.json)
```json
{
"welcomeFile": "/frontfront/index.html",
"routes": [
{
"source": "^/backend/(.*)$",
"target": "/$1",
"destination": "SRV_BACKEND",
"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
}
]
}

 

 

Destination in BTP cockpit

  • Name: SRV_BACKEND
  • URL: https://-back.cfapps..hana.ondemand.com
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • Authentication: OAuth2JWTBearer

 

Frontend manifest.json

"dataSources": {
"backend_odata": {
"uri": "/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
}
}

 

Problem

When the app tries to load metadata (/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/$metadata), I receive 404 Not Found.

Accessing the backend service directly via its URL works fine.

What I tried

  • Verified that the destination exists in BTP cockpit and points to the backend URL.
  • Checked the backend service directly (responds correctly).
  • Reviewed approuter logs — I see messages like “Missing internal url for request …”.

What configuration should I adjust in the approuter or the destination so that the frontend Fiori app can correctly consume the OData service via /backend/...?

Any guidance or working examples would be greatly appreciated

entry.title: CAP Java: CSV data in the test/data folder not loaded duirng local testing
entry.content:
Hi community, 

According to the capire document, CSV data in test/data folder is loaded by default.

https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/databases?impl-variant=java#providing-initial-data

... next to your CDS model files. When you use cds watch or cds deploy, CSV files are loaded by default from test/data. 

However, CSV data in the test/data folder is not loaded during local testing (when running the service with mvn spring-boot:run).

I have tried adding the folllowing setting to the application.yaml and run the application with `mvn spring-boot:run -Dspring-boot.run.profiles=test`, but it's not taking effect.

---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: test
  sql.init.platform: h2
cds:
  data-source.auto-config.enabled: false
  dataSource.csv.paths:
  - test/data/**

I would like to confirm whether I am missing any steps.
